alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 3:09PM PDT until further notice by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grizzly Creek Redwoods State Park, Garberville, Richardson Grove State Park, Myers Flat, Bridgeville, Weott, Alderpoint, Redway, Dinsmore, Pepperwood, Richardson Grove, Miranda, Blocksburg, Fort Seward, Shively, Benbow and Bull Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
